1 {-# Language GeneralizedNewtypeDeriving, 
    2   BangPatterns,
    3   ExistentialQuantification,
    4   TypeSynonymInstances,
    5   FlexibleInstances,
    6   OverlappingInstances #-}
    7 
    8 module Strappy.CL where 
    9 
   10 -- standard library imports
   11 import qualified Data.Map as Map
   12 import Data.Map ((!), keys)
   13 import Data.List (union)
   14 import Control.Monad 
   15 import Control.Monad.Trans.Class
   16 import Control.Monad.State
   17 import qualified Data.Sequence as Seq
   18 import Data.Sequence ( (|>), (<|))
   19 import qualified Data.Foldable as Foldable (toList)
   20 import Data.Function (on)
   21 
   22 --  local imports
   23 import Strappy.Type
   24 import Strappy.CLError
   25 import Strappy.Expr
   26                           
   27 -- | Combinator data type. A well formed combinator is either a
   28 -- primitive combinator (CNode) or the application of a combinator to
   29 -- another combinator (CApp). A not-yet-written combinator is
   30 -- represented by a CTerminal (not well-named).  TODO: we should
   31 -- change the name of CTerminal to something more appropriate.
   32 data Comb = CApp {lComb :: Comb, 
   33                   rComb ::  Comb,
   34                   cType :: Type,
   35                   cAppDepth :: Int,
   36                   cLabel :: Maybe String -- ^ the label of a
   37                                          -- combinator is a unique
   38                                          -- name for the subtree
   39                  }
   40           | CLeaf {cName :: String,
   41                    cExpr :: Expr,
   42                    cType :: Type}
   43           | CInnerNode {cType :: Type} -- ^ a location in a tree 
   44           | CHole {cHole :: Hole}
   45 
   46 class ToComb a where
   47     toComb :: a -> Comb
   48 
   49 data Domain a = Domain [a]
   50 data Hole = forall a. (Show a, Eq a, ToComb a) =>  Hole {holeType :: Type,
   51                                                          holeDomain :: Domain a} 
   52 instance Show Hole where
   53     show (Hole t d) = "hole :: " ++ show t
   54 
   55 instance Eq Hole where
   56     (Hole t d) == (Hole t2 d2) = (t == t2) 
   57 instance Ord Hole where
   58     compare = compare `on` holeType
   59 
   60 -- | Return the precalculated depth of a combinator. 
   61 cDepth :: Comb -> Int
   62 cDepth CLeaf{} = 0
   63 cDepth CHole{} = 0
   64 cDepth CApp{cAppDepth=d} = d
   65 cDepth (CInnerNode _ ) = error "cDepth: A CTerminal has no depth"
   66 
   67 mkAppDepth :: Comb -> Comb -> Int
   68 -- | Calcuate the depth of the combinator resulting from an
   69 -- application.
   70 mkAppDepth c1 c2 = 1 + max (cDepth c1) (cDepth c2)
   71 
   72 isCLeaf (CLeaf{}) = True
   73 isCLeaf _ = False
   74 
   75 type SynthComb = Either String Comb
   76  
   77 app :: SynthComb -> SynthComb -> SynthComb
   78 app m1 m2 = do c1 <- m1
   79                c2 <- m2
   80                case getAppType c1 c2 of
   81                 Left err -> Left err
   82                 Right t -> let d = mkAppDepth c1 c2 
   83                            in Right $ CApp c1 c2 t d Nothing
   84 
   85 app' :: Comb -> Comb -> Comb
   86 -- | Returns the combinator resulting from the application of two
   87 -- combinators. Throws error if there is a type mismatch. 
   88 app' c1 c2 = case getAppType c1 c2 of
   89                Left err -> error $ "Error in app' in CL.hs: " ++ err
   90                Right t -> let d = mkAppDepth c1 c2
   91                               in CApp c1 c2 t d Nothing
   92 
   93 infixl 4 <:>
   94 -- | Alias for app.
   95 (<:>) = app
   96 
   97 infixl 4 <::>
   98 (<::>) = \m1 c2 ->  m1 <:> (return c2)
   99                   
  100 
  101 instance Show Comb where
  102     show CApp{lComb=c1, rComb=c2} = "(" ++ show c1 ++ " " ++ show c2 ++ ")"
  103     show (CLeaf n _ _) = n
  104     show (CInnerNode t) =  "CTerm: " ++ show t
  105     show (CHole h) = show h
  106 
  107 -- | An alternative to show: if combinator is named and evaluates to a
  108 -- number or bool, show it an an evaluated expressions.
  109 show' (CLeaf n _ _ ) = n
  110 show' c@(CApp{lComb=c1, rComb=c2}) = case reduceComb c of
  111                              (N i) -> show i
  112                              (C c) -> show c
  113                              _     ->  "(" ++ show' c1 ++ " " ++ show' c2 ++ ")"
  114 
  115 instance Eq Comb where
  116     (CApp{lComb=c1, rComb=c2, cAppDepth=dl}) == (CApp{lComb=b1, rComb=b2, cAppDepth=dr}) = (dl == dr) && (c1 == b1) && (c2 == b2)
  117     (CLeaf{cName=n}) == (CLeaf{cName=m}) = (n==m)
  118     a == b = False
  119 
  120 instance Ord Comb where 
  121     compare c1 c2 = compare (show c1) (show c2)
  122 
  123 num2C :: Int -> Comb 
  124 -- | Convert integer to a combinator.
  125 num2C i = CLeaf (show i) (N i) tInt
  126 
  127 dOp2C :: String -- ^ operator name
  128       -> (Int -> Int -> Int) -- ^ operator
  129       -> Comb
  130 -- | Convert a binary integer operator to an expression.
  131 dOp2C opString op = CLeaf opString func (tInt ->-  tInt ->- tInt)
  132     where func = Func $ \(N !x) -> Func $ \(N !y) -> N $ op x y
  133 
  134 bool2C :: Bool -> Comb
  135 -- | Convert a boolean value to a combinator.
  136 bool2C c = CLeaf (show c) (B c) tBool
  137 
  138 instance ToComb Bool where
  139     toComb = bool2C
  140 instance ToComb Int where
  141     toComb = num2C
  142 
  143 
  144 
  145 getType :: Comb -> Either String Type
  146 -- | Get the type of a combinator outside the type inference monad.
  147 getType (CLeaf _ _ t) = Right t
  148 getType c@(CApp{lComb=c1, rComb=c2}) = getAppType c1 c2
  149 getType c@(CInnerNode t) = Right t
  150 getType (CHole (Hole t _)) = Right t
  151 
  152 getAppType :: Comb -> Comb -> Either String Type
  153 -- | Returns the type of an application of two combinators. If there
  154 -- is a type mismatch, returns Left.
  155 getAppType c1 c2  
  156     = let st = do t1 <- lift (getType c1) >>= freshInst
  157                   t2 <- lift (getType c2) >>= freshInst
  158                   t <- newTVar Star
  159                   case mgu t1 (t2 ->- t) of 
  160                     Nothing -> lift $ Left $ "Type error: " ++ " unable to unify " 
  161                                ++ show t1 ++ " and " ++ show t2 
  162                                ++ " when attempting to apply " 
  163                               ++  show c1 ++ " to " ++ show c2
  164                     Just subst -> return $ toType (apply subst t1)
  165       in liftM fst $ runStateT st 0                                         
  166 
  167 sub :: TyVar -> Type -> Comb -> Comb
  168 -- | Apply a substitution to a type inside a combinator.
  169 sub s (TVar u) c@(CLeaf _ _ t) = c{cType = apply [(s, TVar u)] (cType c)}
  170 
  171 getTvs :: Comb -> [TyVar]
  172 -- | Returns all type variables used in a combinator                                      
  173 getTvs (CLeaf _ _ t) = tv t
  174 getTvs CApp{lComb=cl, rComb=cr} = getTvs cl `union` getTvs cr
  175 
  176 comb2Expr :: Comb -> Expr
  177 -- | Returns expression associated with combinator. 
  178 comb2Expr CApp{lComb=c1, rComb=c2} = App (comb2Expr c1) (comb2Expr c2)
  179 comb2Expr c@(CLeaf _ e _) = e
  180 
  181 filterCombinatorsByType :: [Comb] -> Type -> StateT Int [] Comb
  182 filterCombinatorsByType (c:cs) t  
  183     = do ct <- freshInst (cType c)
  184          case mgu ct t of
  185            Just sub -> (return  (c{cType = apply sub ct})) `mplus` rest
  186            Nothing -> rest
  187       where rest = filterCombinatorsByType cs t
  188 filterCombinatorsByType [] t = lift []
  189 
  190 
  191 ----------------------------------------------------------------------
  192 -- Reducing combinator -- 
  193 
  194 reduceComb :: Comb -> Expr
  195 -- | Convert a combinator to an expression and reduce. 
  196 reduceComb c =  reduce ( comb2Expr c)
  197 
  198 fitCombWithHoles :: Comb -> Comb
  199 fitCombWithHoles c = let holes = getHoles c
  200                      in undefined
  201 
  202 
  203 ----------------------------------------------------------------------
  204 -- Holes -------------------------------------------------------------
  205 data Dir = L | R deriving (Show, Ord, Eq)
  206 type TrPtr = Seq.Seq Dir
  207 instance Show TrPtr where 
  208     show xs = show (Foldable.toList xs)
  209  
  210 getHoles :: Comb -> [(Hole, TrPtr)]
  211 -- | getHoles takes a combinator and returns a list of holes and their
  212 -- locations (i.e. pointers of type TrPtr to their locations in a tree).
  213 getHoles c = getHoles' [] Seq.empty c
  214     where getHoles' holes ptr CApp{lComb=l, rComb=r} 
  215               = let leftHoles = getHoles' holes (ptr |> L) l
  216                     rightHoles = getHoles' leftHoles (ptr |> R)  r
  217                 in rightHoles
  218           getHoles' holes ptr CHole{cHole=h} = (h,ptr):holes
  219           getHoles' holes _ _ = holes
  220 
  221 
  222 productOfHoles (Hole{holeDomain=(Domain x)}:[]) = [[toComb a] | a <- x]
  223 productOfHoles (Hole{holeDomain=(Domain x)}:xs) = [((toComb a):as)| a <- x, as <- productOfHoles xs]
  224 
  225 resolveCombHoles :: Comb -> [Comb]
  226 -- | Given a combinator with holes, this function returns a lazy list
  227 -- of all combinators formed by extending each hole to one of its
  228 -- domain values.
  229 resolveCombHoles c@(CApp{lComb=l, rComb=r}) = do l' <- resolveCombHoles l
  230                                                  r' <- resolveCombHoles r
  231                                                  return c{lComb=l', rComb=r'}
  232 resolveCombHoles CHole{cHole=Hole{holeDomain=(Domain xs)}} = [toComb x | x <- xs]
  233 resolveCombHoles c = [c]
  234 
  235 intIntervalDomain :: Int -> Int -> Domain Int
  236 intIntervalDomain a b = Domain [a..b]
  237 
  238 intIntervalHole :: Int -> Int -> Hole
  239 intIntervalHole a b = Hole tInt $ intIntervalDomain a b
  240 
  241 intHole = intIntervalHole 0 1
  242 boolHole = Hole tBool (Domain [True, False])
  243
